forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy, with a low around 51. Southeast wind around 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy, with a high near 56. Southeast wind 7 to 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As dawn unfolds over Downtown San Francisco, the city finds itself wrapped in a veil of persistent rain and shadowy clouds, the kind that seems to resonate with the tranquil pulse of a quiet, rainy morning. The air hangs heavy, carrying the fragrance of wet asphalt and the distant echo of raindrops making their gentle descent. With temperatures resting in the low fifties, residents are reminded that this is a day to embrace the cozy embrace of their favorite layers. A waterproof jacket, perhaps paired with a soft scarf, will serve not only as a barrier against the damp chill but also as a nod to the charm of a city that dances to its own rhythm—even in the rain.

Outside, visibility may be shrouded, with fog curling around familiar sites, lending a mystical quality to the already breathtaking views of the Golden Gate, which lies hidden among the gray. For those who are inclined to explore, this is an invitation to settle into a quaint café, where the clinking of cups and the warmth of brewed coffee provide the perfect counterbalance to the weather outside. Alternatively, a bookshop may beckon, offering solace and the companionship of stories. In the spirit of the day, a leisurely stroll under an umbrella can unearth the subtle beauty of rain-soaked streets and glistening leaves, connecting heart and city in a tranquil dance of reflections.
